attributes.action: award a posthumous honour to Lemmy of Motorhead  for services to music
attributes.additional_details: Lemmy, born Ian Fraser Kilmister, formed Motörhead in 1975 and was its only constant member, as singer and bassist. The band released 23 studio albums and are best known for their 1980 single Ace of Spades.
attributes.background: Ian Fraser Kilmister or Lemmy from Motorhead died on December 28, 2015, without a doubt he put Britain on the map in terms of popular rock music, in these days when someone like Damon Albarn is honoured it would be negligent not to award Lemmy a similar honour.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it asks for someone to be nominated for an honour. 

Members of the public can nominate people for honours directly. You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour here:

https://www.gov.uk/honours
